attributes.title: Congrats!
attributes.description: Congratulations on completing Intermediate React v6 by Brian Holt, taught through Frontend Masters. You're now ready to deploy and enhance your React projects, exploring cloud integration with services like Vercel and Neon, and adding advanced features like authentication and social media-like functionalities. Share your builds and innovations with the community and continue to expand your skills in web development.

post.html:
üéâ You did it! üéâ

Congrats, this is a lot of info all at once, but you can call yourself well equipped to take on any problem with React, server-side or not!

So where do you go from here? Well, here's some fun ideas:

  • Take your favorite app here (maybe the Next.js one) and deploy it to a service. Vercel is particularly well equipped for Next.js apps
  • Take your database to the cloud! I'm obviously biased towards Neon but any cloud database will work. I actually manage the integration between Vercel and Neon!
  • Add more features to your note passing app.
    • Add real auth. Neon Auth or Clerk would be two great options so you can actually have real users.
    • Make it into more of a Twitter feed so you can follow people and post general notes, not just direct messages.
    • Add an admin feature that allows the teacher to remove or edit notes.
    • Use something like Llama locally or Claude/ChatGPT to add a summary ability so you feed in all of a user's notes and get back a summary of the notes they've received

Let me know what you build! Tweet/post at me on ùïè or Bluesky!

Thank you and go build cool shit!
